commitResults.messageBody:
Test file should belong under test folder. Expected text files will be
placed under test/resources in future.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: encapsulate greet and bye into functions
commitResults.messageBody:
Code readability in main function call. In preparation for
Level 1 commit

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Parser package that make sense of user input
commitResults.messageBody:
User can input arbitary commands. A class is designed to accept the
input and make sense of it for Duke class.

Allows for abstraction of user input from Duke class.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Duke uses parser interface for command fetching
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke class responsibility is to provide UI and should not be bothered
with handling of various user input. Parser abstracts message
fetching.

Parser class did not catch exception when there is no input by user.
Message wrapped in try block to ensure that no null message is
captured and passed to Duke.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: Test case for Parser and Duke
chore: update to adhere coding standard
feat: Task class to handle task input
commitResults.messageBody:
User inputs must be handled and stored in some Array. Task class created
to store the details and the controller will handle the addition of new
Tasks and to pass the list to Duke class

User can input any types of command. Enum will be used to group the
command into 3 category.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Parser class abstract message fetching
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke will only call Parser to obtain the Command given by user. Parser
will call for next message once Duke is done handling the current
message.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Duke class class add and list
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke needs to be able to add and list task. Updates to Parser and Task
allows Duke to perform the requirements

Printing did not have consistent tab spacing. Print now modified to
stream message instead and Duke should provide the printing since it
handles the UI.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Argument class used for passing paramters
commitResults.messageBody:
Parameter passing done by generic array is not ideal especially for
testing purposes. Class created to store args for object passesing.

Command was done through string comparison. spelling mistakes are
picked up and perceived as commands. Parser should only recognise
commands as the first word of the input.

Task can be marked or unmarked depending on the status. Message
status will be passed back to Duke for UI.
Adhere to naming convention
Test correctness of logic of code

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: modified constructors to call mutator
commitResults.messageBody:
Mutator will be subsequently implemented with error checking. Use of mutators abstracts check
and allow raising of exceptions.

DukeException acts like the super Exception for all other exception
thrown in this project to allow for easy debugging and testing.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: class update to handle DukeException
commitResults.messageBody:
Exploits polymorphism properties to handle exception. Better code
redability and debugging.
Extend Task class to allow for specialised tasking that user can use.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Update task package to handle new subclass
commitResults.messageBody:
task package should handle an abstracted view of different types of
classes. Polymorphism exploited here to reduce hard coding.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Update parser package for task subclass
refactor: parser handling of task arguments
commitResults.messageBody:
Parser should not handle the arugments of each task subclass as code
cannot scale. Task should be incharge of parsing the arguments once the
specific tasking requested is known by parser.

- Parser.getTask() will get each subclass to make sense of the argument
- if argument is invalid then exception will be thrown which will be made
known to the user
Readability for other coders

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Test using the I/O redirection technique
commitResults.messageBody:
Use the input/output redirection technique to semi-automate the testing
of Duke

UI class abstracts ui printing from duke, making the code more readable
and easy to understand.
console has basic added color
removed testduke as the test should be on UI class instead

commitResults.messageTitle: doc: doc for methods left out

commitResults.messageBody: update expected changes. Fixed javac classpath

Task deletion now possible with the updated parser class which checks if
the command is to delete. Error handling is also checked for.
Purpose is to make sense of text file

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: integration of serialise with duke
commitResults.messageBody:
Modifications of duke to load file before starting program and to store
the objects into the text file.

commitResults.messageTitle: doc: java doc for interface class
